intro: Hieracium linguicorde, commonly known as the tongue-shaped hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while its flowers consist of yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk. Hieracium linguicorde is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions, making it a common sight in many temperate regions.
